text:
Improvement pill here so recently i made
some simple changes to my daily routine

which allowed me to get significantly
more done than i did before i went from

creating just three to four videos a
month

to doing more than eight so in a sense i
was able to double my productivity and i

was able to do this
by implementing five simple proven

tricks for getting more done
our first trick is all about finding an

exclusive location
for your work so the thing is i am

currently renting out a studio apartment
in ho chi minh of vietnam

and it's nice and all but i found that i
would constantly get distracted

trying to work at the table in this room
and that's because i do

all sorts of things in this particular
location the seat and table that i try

to work at
is the same seat and table where i would

play video games on my computer it's the
same seat and table where i would eat

lunch and dinner and it's the same seat
and table where i would watch netflix

with my girlfriend
and the thing is when you're in a

location where you've done so many other
things your brain will associate this

location with all those things
it will have unconsciously built several

habits
tied to this place so whenever you're

there you're going to be
constantly reminded to start those

habits
most of which are things that are much

more enjoyable and pleasurable
than your work and because of this it

becomes extremely easy to get distracted
as your brain is constantly telling you

hey
let's do this fun thing instead which is

why it's extremely powerful
to have a completely new location

exclusive
to your work and ideally you want to

select a location
where you haven't made any other

pre-existing connections
a location where you can start a brand

new
slate i was able to implement this trick

by moving my work location to a local
cafe

not too far from my apartment it's like
a two minute walk and on the first day

i got there i immediately sat down and i
started

writing because i wanted my brain to
associate this new environment with one

thing and one thing only
which is my work it's also very

important to note that you want to
select

a location that's easy to get to so that
you will have less excuses to start

which brings us to the second trick i
used to double my productivity

which is don't give yourself time to
think

now you might be thinking wait what
don't think

how could that be beneficial well prior
to making these changes

i would often have thoughts like this
when i woke up oh

wow i need to start working on those two
new scripts today and uh

i need to revise and finalize that other
one i need to send out those emails and

oh i got
three coaching calls as well oh my god

that's so much work
i think i'll just watch some youtube

first and whenever this happens i would
end up playing around on my

phone for hours before finally getting
out of bed

and overall i would get very little to
nothing done

for the day and you can prevent this
from happening by giving yourself

less time to think nowadays the only
thing that's on my mind when i wake up

is
okay time to get dressed and visit the

cafe across the street
and the reason i do this is because

procrastination
is an emotional problem and negative

emotions occur
when we think right the more you think

about how much you have to do
the worse you start to feel which means

that you're less likely to actually
go and do it it's sort of like back in

the day when i used to talk to random
girls on the street

as a way to improve my social skills and
to step outside of my comfort zone

i noticed that my levels of fear and
anxiety were significantly higher

when i saw a girl that i wanted to talk
to and i thought

about what i should do first that's
right the longer i thought about

talking to her the less of a chance i
would actually go and do it

because when you think you let your
anxiety build up

you think to yourself oh my god what am
i going to talk about

what if i get rejected what if she
totally ignores me

all of these hypothetical scenarios run
in your head and cause you to feel as if

you have failed
even though you haven't even started

that's why we procrastinate
and you can prevent this from happening

by taking quick action
like i mentioned before all i think

about when i wake up is okay i need to
get dressed and visit the cafe that's it

and by doing this i can trick myself to
take quick action

so that i'll go to my exclusive location
so that my habit of working there can

kick
in and this actually brings us to my

third tip which is to remove
distractions

before they can come up when i decided
to go to this cafe for the first time

i chose not to get the wi-fi password
that's right to this day my laptop still

has no internet access here i literally
can't do anything on my laptop

other than right see the thing is even
if you use my advice from trick number

one and you go to a new location
there are still things that you might

bring with you that are associated with
past

distractions and personally for me it's
when i have my computer

and when i have wi-fi because this setup
is what i usually use to play video

games and to browse the internet
when i remove the wi-fi the urge to mess

around online disappears
as one of the requirements for being

able to do so is the wi-fi itself
which is why whenever i come to this

cafe i only bring four things i bring my
keys

so i can go home i bring my bullet
journal which serves as a reminder for

all the things i need to get done
i bring my laptop for the work itself

and i bring my phone for calls
now you might be thinking wait wait wait

you just said you turn off the wi-fi so
you don't get distracted

then doesn't bring in your phone defeat
that purpose

hang tight i'll get into why i do this
in a second

in the meantime let's move on to my
fourth trick which is

to allow yourself to win easily
see oftentimes when we tell ourselves

that we need to get a lot done
we will set this bar way too high

you need to lower your standards for
your definition of success

for the day for example i never tell
myself okay i need to draft

and finalize the script in the same day
in fact

as i'm writing this script right now i'm
just quickly letting all of my ideas out

i'm not double checking my grammar i'm
not worrying about spelling errors

and i'm not even checking to see if
everything makes sense

all i'm doing is getting all of my ideas
on

paper that's my only requirement today
for success in regards to this project

that's all i have to do if i want to
clean up the script

sure i can do that for bonus points but
in reality i don't need to do that

until tomorrow and the reason i do this
is because it makes it significantly

easier for me to feel good about myself
it makes me more confident in my ability

to get things done
that i can reach my goals i feel proud

of myself even though i'm just drafting
a script

see the thing you have to understand
about productivity is that it's mostly a

mental battle
if you believe something is too hard if

you believe that you're not mentally
strong enough to easily complete a task

then you will naturally come up with
excuses to avoid even trying

which is why you got to allow yourself
to win easier

lower your bar for success because then
you can hit it more often

which will make you believe that you are
someone who can successfully get things

done
and because of this it will make the

entire process
more enjoyable and now finally my final

trick for doubling one's productivity
is to reward yourself often one of the

most important things that you have to
understand

is that every good behavior that you
want to reinforce

needs to be reinforced with some type of
reward

it's like when you train a dog you got
to give him a treat

after he does a trick if you do not
reward yourself your brain will have no

incentive to remember this behavior and
it will never

become a habit now it's best to reward
yourself with things that you naturally

like
but you should also make sure that there

are things that you aren't addicted to
for example every time i complete a

major task such as drafting a script or
revising a script or even finishing a

call i'll open up my phone
and play a mobile game for like five to

ten minutes or sometimes i'll use social
media i might respond to some messages

look at some memes on reddit you get the
point and this is why i bring my phone

with me to the cafe when i work
yes it's important to try and remove as

many distractions as possible when i
come here

but i still need some way to reward
myself turning the wi-fi on for my

computer is too distracting
as i'm constantly using it while i type

but i can simply turn off my phone
or hide it under my journal while i work

which puts it out of my site
and when it's time for me to reward

myself i'll turn it back on
now you want to make sure that your

rewards are short and sweet so that it's
enjoyable

but doesn't take up too much of your
time that way you can go back to work

and complete your next task by doing
this you will actually find yourself

looking forward to going to work
because there are little bits of

pleasure and joy sprinkled throughout
the process

and that's it these are the five tricks
that i use to double my productivity

try them out and let me know if they
work this episode was brought to you

with the help of the guys
at audible i've been an avid user of

audible for many years
because it allows me to learn valuable

life-changing things on the go
i've been commuting around a lot in the

city via motorbike and using audible has
allowed me to finish about a book per

week
you are now able to download all of the

audible monthly originals for
free along with one free audiobook of

your choice
members will also gain access to guided

wellness programs that will help you
unwind

during these stressful times on top of
that audible has launched

stories.audible.com
where you can stream hundreds of titles

completely free with no strings attached
go to www.audible.com forward slash

improvement pill or text improvement
pill

to 500 500 to get one free audiobook
unlimited audible originals and a 30-day

free trial
recently i've just finished listening to

the price of tomorrow by jeff
boof which talks about how technology

will cause massive deflation around the
world

and what this means for the economy it's
super interesting and a quick read so i

highly suggest
you to check it out besides that guys
stay tuned
